note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: External call (msg.sender.transfer) is made before updating the Deposits mapping, allowing the caller to withdraw repeatedly without state change (classic reentrancy pattern).
The proxy() function is public and lacks the onlyOwner modifier, allowing any caller to execute arbitrary low-level calls with value
Unchecked addition on Deposits[msg.sender] using Deposits[msg.sender] += msg.value can overflow in Solidity <0.8.0
The low-level call target.call.value(msg.value)(data) is invoked without checking its return value, leading to a potential silent failure.
Floating pragma specification (^0.4.24) allows compilation with multiple compiler versions, leading to unpredictable behavior and potential inconsistencies.
